definitions.definition: to tie the arms and legs of someone together tightly and roughly with rope to prevent them from moving or escaping:
examples: Police said the couple had been trussed up and robbed before being shot.

definitions.definition: to prepare a bird for cooking by tying its wings and legs to its body
a device for holding an organ of the body, especially part of the intestine, in its correct position after it has moved because of an injury
